companies.company_name: Green Century MSCI Intl Indx Instl

key_risks: ESG Criteria Subjectivity: Reliance on ESG screening introduces subjectivity in company selection, potentially impacting performance and investor confidence.
Performance Volatility: Exposure to global market risks, including economic downturns, currency fluctuations, and geopolitical instability.
Greenwashing Concerns: Reputational risks if ESG practices are perceived as insufficiently rigorous or transparent.
Dependence on MSCI: Vulnerability to inaccuracies or changes in MSCI's methodology.
controversies: Potential greenwashing accusations due to perceived lack of rigor in ESG practices.
Debates over inclusion/exclusion decisions based on subjective ESG criteria.
environmental_issues: Fossil fuel-free focus may limit exposure to certain sectors, potentially impacting diversification.
social_issues: Subjectivity in ESG screening could lead to social controversies over company selection.
governance_issues: Reliance on MSCI's ESG data and methodology may introduce governance risks related to data accuracy and transparency.

sources.title: International Index Fund Investor - Green Century
sources.snippet: The Green Century MSCI International Index Fund is one of the first fossil fuel free index funds available to U.S. investors. The Green Century MSCI International Index Fund is invested in the stocks of about 175 large- and mid-cap companies headquartered in 22 of the 23 developed markets, including Japan, Germany, France, Canada, Switzerland, and 16 additional countries.

sources.title: The Funds - Green Century
sources.snippet: The Green Century MSCI International Index Fund is a passively managed mutual fund that invests in companies in all developed markets outside of the U.S. It is one of the first environmentally responsible, fossil fuel free international index funds available to U.S. investors.
